title: E Ola Ka 'Olelo Hawai'i
description: Every two weeks a language dies with its last speaker. That was the fate of Hawaiian, until a group of second-language learners put up a fight and declared, "E Ola Ka 'Olelo Hawai'i" (The Hawaiian Language Shall Live!!!)
copyright: Copyright 2015-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
